data.title: Qt4.8.5 + urho1.3.1 ,Opengl glew init error
Update Log.h
data.body: Allows these logging shortcuts to be used from 3rd party programs that don't use the namespace.

data.title: ./cmake_ios gives CMake Error: Internal CMake error
data.body:
my set up :
latest version of the engine as this msg send.
running : ./cmake_ios.sh gives me error
using OS X ver 10.9.2
xcode 5.1 
cmake version 2.8.10
reproduce :
when i run : ./cmake_ios.sh -DURHO3D_ANGELSCRIPT=0 every thing compiles fine without the player 

But when i 
run : ./cmake_ios.sh   ( with no parameters ) 
I'm getting error

runing  cmake_clean and
then i run ./cmake_ios.sh -DURHO3D_ANGELSCRIPT=1
I'm getting error

runing  cmake_clean and 
then ./cmake_ios.sh -DURHO3D_ANGELSCRIPT=0  ( yes the one that worked at first )

data.title: Editor resource browser & right click menus
data.body:
Do not merge just yet.  This is still a work in progress.

I have added via brute force a mechanism which scans each file in the resourceDirs.  It checks the binary signature/xml root if it can and falls back to file extensions for some meaningful cases.  It is honestly really hard to account for every possibility the browser can handle.  I would like some opinions on how it can be improved without having to change too much about it.  I would also understand if this is rejected because of code impact.

The resource browser items can be dragged into the hierarchy in many cases.  I chose to not instance a node to put components in.  These things are naturally to debate.  You can drag prefabs and materials into the viewport.  You can right click on both the hierarchy and browser items to get a context menu.  There are lots of missing integrations I am sure.

Potential Issues
- The file scanning can produce errors.  A mechanism for silencing logs would be useful during scanning.

Known Bugs
- Opacity of the file list isn't the right color.
- The drag cursor isn't right for dragging file items into the viewport.
- Kinda Ugly.

I will do a pass to fix the issues with the coding guidelines.  I would like to get opinions on this beast and get it up to snuff!  When I worked in master I missed the browser.  Hopefully others will like it.

:heart: :heart: 
Chris

data.title: IME support for CJK text input
2D aspect ratio distorted when changing device orientation
data.body:
2D display aspect ratio is no longer preserved when switching between landscape/portrait (changing device orientation) on Android.

Steps to reproduce:
- deploy 27_Urho2DPhysics on device
- change device orientation

data.title: SDL Gesture events
data.body: Please consider adding SDL Gesture events (SDL_MULTIGESTURE, SDL_DOLLARGESTURE, SDL_DOLLARRECORD).

data.title: Doc for attribute name.
data.body: Attribute animation system use attribute name to set animation, we need a documentation for it.

data.title: MinGW make does not build samples
data.body:
Since the last 3-4 updates, the MinGW build has not been building any samples. I have cleaned and reconfigured cmake several times using the following settings:

cmake_mingw -DENABLE_LUA=0 -DENABLE_SAFE_LUA=0 -DENABLE_LUAJIT=0 -DENABLE_SAMPLES=1 -DURHO3D_STATIC_BUILD=1 -DENABLE_ANGELSCRIPT=0 -DENABLE_PROFILING=0 -DENABLE_MINIDUMPS=0

data.title: Change UIElement position, size etc to Vector2 type.
data.body: Because IntVector2 is not an interpolatable type, when apply attribute animation to it. the animation not smooth, it look jump. So I prefer to change UIElement's position and size to Vector2 type.

data.title: physics world ray cast fail
data.body:
Hi, all 
I use raycast for collision detection, but I don't know why this method fail.
I have 4 cars in the scene,  theirs config is below:
![car](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7183905/2663392/66d61d20-c058-11e3-8f53-eb59d05f2675.png)

![car-shape](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7183905/2663397/9489c6a4-c058-11e3-80ed-4dcf55734532.png)

``` c++
    PhysicsRaycastResult result;
    PODVector<PhysicsRaycastResult> results;
    physicsWorld_->Raycast(results, Ray(node_->GetPosition(), node_->GetDirection()), 200);

    LOGERRORF("result %i", results.Size());

    physicsWorld_->RaycastSingle(result, Ray(node_->GetPosition(), node_->GetDirection()), 200);
    if (result.body_)
    {
        LOGERRORF("found , dis %f", result.distance_);
    }
```

My goal is that  whether the back car would "see" the front car or not.

data.title: Node transform space refactoring
data.body:
- Translate(), Rotate() and LookAt() functions now take a transform space (local, parent or world). 
- Translate() has a behavior change: default space is local, as that is most often used in eg. camera movement, and is consistent with the default for rotations (the earlier fixedAxis = false was same as local space). 
- The redundant TranslateRelative() function is removed. 
- Adds RotateAround() function, which allows rotating around a pivot in either local, parent or world space.

Changing Translate() behavior and removing TranslateRelative() is kind of nasty, but in this case we've had an inconsistency for years: translate would work in parent space, while the default for rotations would be local space. So if we take the "hit" now, we'll end up with a more consistent API and have less typing for the common case (camera or character moving relative to its local coordinate axes)

data.body:
Hi,
This issue is discussing in forum, http://urho3d.prophpbb.com/topic169.html, I think this is very useful and common for game developing, cause I need it right now.
I need rotate a car around it head, and around it rear after a while, the pivot is dynamic, so it can't be specified from 3d model builder or using orbiting.
Will you add this api  or is there any way to achieve this purpose? The scale is the same.
Thank you!

data.title: Add Lua script instance support in editor.
data.body: Add Lua script instance support in editor.

data.title: StringHash and ShortStringHash should be able to reconstruct back to String.
data.body: Useful for iterating through maps by keys, especially if the key is meaningful.

data.title: Spawn window in editor
data.body:
I implemented new functionality in editor which allows to spray prefabs saved by "save node" option. This is very useful if somebody would like to create large number of objects (lets say grass, trees) on the surface.
There are some parameters which modify each object randomly like random rotation on each axis and random scale. Also there is option to orient the spawned nodes by surface normal which is enabled by default.
The tool can be also precise when you set spawning area to 0 and count to 1 which will create object exactly under mouse cursor.
New window can also spawn multiple objects randomly to make a better result. Lets say you are spawning 5 different types of trees so it look more natural. You can also pick the same object many times to increase probability of spawning that object.

The surface which we are spawning at can be determined by graphical objects or physics objects, you can switch between them by choosing picking type of objects CTRL+6.
Spawn window can be enabled in View tab.

![spawn](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2963404/2591720/5b3599cc-ba6e-11e3-9037-79fadaff8392.png)
![spawn2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2963404/2591721/5b3a12c2-ba6e-11e3-9099-e2a48752cf87.png)

Chris

It might be worth noting that there are no lights.  Also lots of StaticModelGroups.

data.title: Execute system command async
data.body: This would give the ability to launch potentially long running processes without blocking urho.  An event with with exit code and stdout would be a nice touch.

data.title: Text selection/painting for non-editable text fields
data.body: F.ex. it would be handy to be able to selected and copy the output of the drop-down console.

data.title: Editor should allow customize for UI callbacks
data.body: It's a long process to search for a UIElement, and then assign a callback to it, when it can simply be done in the editor after specifying an event type and a callback name.

data.title: Doesn't compile with QtCreator (5.2.0, MinGW4.8.0), Cmake 2.8.12
data.body:
I added the following lines in CMakeLists.txt to get it work

IF(CMAKE_VERSION VERSION_GREATER "2.8.11")
  CMAKE_POLICY(SET CMP0022 OLD)
ENDIF()

data.body:
[Corrected from previous Pull Request]

In "ToDoxHook.lua":
- Added "getCurrentDirectory" function;
- Added process to fetch and map C++ headers' descriptions to Lua elements;
- [TODO] Write descriptions from Lua elements for Doxygen output.

In "ToZerobraneStudioHook.lua":
- Writes descriptions from Lua elements for ZerobraneStudio API file.

data.title: Why force landscape mode in iOS?
Incomplete NavigationMesh rebuild when moving from one tile to another
data.body:
When moving an object from one tile to another, NavigationMesh::Build(BoundingBox) rebuilds only one of the 2 tiles.

Steps to replicate (using 15_Navigation.lua):

In AddOrRemoveObject(), replace:
    hitNode:Remove()
by:
    hitNode.position = hitNode.position + Vector3(10, 0, 0)

Now create a mushroom using middle mouse button:
- if mushroom moves inside the same tile, everything is OK (initial position and new position are rebuilt)
- if mushroom moves from one tile to another one, initial position is rebuilt, but new position is not.

To fix this we can add a second rebuild for new position, something like:
    navMesh:Build(updateBox) -- Update origin tile
    navMesh:Build(hitDrawable.worldBoundingBox) -- Update destination tile

I think this should not be done in script, and there is certainly a better way to get the job done.

data.title: Escape cancels ui dragging
data.body: If you press escape while dragging it cancels the ui element dragging.

data.title: Window/View Resize option
data.body:
When you resize the window of game or change X x X settings, this no increases the visual field horizontal or vertical.
In Urho3D at resize the window for example in ninja demo you have more field of view.
